intro: Strophanthus glaber, commonly known as the naked-stemmed arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with toxic properties. The plant is characterized by its smooth, often woody stems and clusters of yellowish or orange flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical in shape. The plant is known for producing cardiac glycosides, which have been used in traditional medicine and have potential pharmaceutical applications.
